For quite a while I have been thinking about buying a stand to hold my cross stitch and on impulse this morning I ordered an Elan lap stand. I was going to ask for it for Christmas but that seems such a long, long way away. Plus, Pete bought just bought himself a new digital camera so it's my turn for a treat! It was great to have my sweetie home yesterday and the dogs were pleased to see him too. Trusty seems to be getting a little worse at the moment and he fell down the stairs last night. He is OK but I was glad to have Pete there in case he hurt himself. I'm not sure how well I'd cope if anything happened to Trusty while Pete was away. Problems are continuing to frustrate me at work. I am counting down the hours until I can go home and play with the animals, Pete and my stitching. Last night I finished the actual ark and have decided I will keep going and finish the whole scene. After doing so much over one lately it's a nice change to be stitching over 2 on 28 count fabbie - it grows so fast!

I'm feeling very spoilt as Lucy just took me out for a margarita and dinner - a nice way to unwind! Gladys and Mo walked the dogs after work so that saved me another job. I just need to wait for a break in the thunderstorms so I can give them their final walk before bed. We had some wicked storms last night and Emma was very scared. She spent most of the night wimpering and trying to hide under my pillow or sit on my head. Not very conducive to a peaceful night's sleep! We all miss Pete and will be glad to see him tomorrow. There is just enough time left for a little cross stitch to end the day.

I have been in a relatively good mood lately but a few things are bothering me today. Pete is in Philly until Wed evening so I am home alone with the doggies. I don't mind being home by myself but I know I will be exhausted come Wednesday without Pete to collect me from the train, make me dinner, and also look after the dogs who will want to be walked late at night and then early in the morning. Yesterday we went to Melanie's birthday party which was her annual crab feast. I was really looking forward to it because I LOVE crabs and I did enjoy the crabs a lot. What makes me grumble though is that it cost me an unbelievable $100 ($50 each for Pete and I). The crab feast itself was $24.95 but then there was tax, tip, and loads of beer and side dishes they ordered. Also, a couple of the guys ordered a couple of dozen large crabs and I think they were $48 a dozen. The trouble with this group is that they automatically divide up the check, no matter who ordered what so it ended up being way more expensive that I thought it would be. It's OK for them as they all have well-paying jobs but my post doc salary doesn't stretch that far! I was also embarassed as we were the only ones who didn't bring a gift. Pete says I shouldn't feel bad as she didn't give me anything for my birthday, and we also paid for a share of her dinner. To make matters worse those that were left in the lab last week took her to The Cheescake Factory for lunch which ended up costing me $55 - $35 for me and my share of Melanie's lunch and I paid $20 for our summer student because there was no way I could ask her for $35 for a measly lunch. I can think of plenty of ways I would rather have spent $155. I have spent months trying to get a PCR to work and in desperation this morning RH asked JC to do the experiment for me. Of course a few hours later and he has the results that I haven't been able to achieve. He did a few things different to me and while I know it's not my fault (I was following the published protocol after all), I feel really stupid. Now I have to repeat the experiment using his conditions and I pray mine works too, otherwise I'm going to look totally incompetent. My last whine for today - I did some work in the front garden and despite covering myself in copious amounts of Deet the mosquitoes "got me", including 3 bites on my face. Ouch, they itch! I just want to go home and stitch. I made some good progress on my Ark during the SAL so I will post a photo tonight.

We went up to Arundel Mills today as I still need to find something to wear to Nancy's wedding (not to mention my own!!). Needless to say I wandered around aimlessly and came home with nothing. Pete had a much more successful expedition and bought mouse traps, sandpaper and a plastic painting tarp. I think I'll probably have more luck at some of the bigger department stores over in Montgomery County. Even though it's the middle of summer the stores are starting to get their fall clothing lines in and the summer stock are rather depleted. This will probably be a Xmas pressie for one of the girls in the lab - and I know just who these colors will suit too! Now it's back to the laundry and other domestic chores. I'll be stitching on Noah's Ark tonight.

Tonight we watched a live cricket match! Pete heard about it on the Bowie Baysox website and the game was between DC Forward (is that really the best name you could come up with??) and Florida Thunder. It was actually a lot of fun and because the baseball field is so small we were really close to the action. 90% of the team and crowd were Indian/Pakistani/West Indian and Pete may have actually been the only American there! Both teams had one Aussie. I'm guessing that there were about 200 people watching but they were all pretty vocal in support of the local team. Sadly they were all out for 88 after 13 overs (I think it was supposed to be a 20 over game and each over was 5 balls) which the opposition made without too much trouble. A nice way to end the work week and start the weekend. Thanks for coming to the game with me sweetie - I hope you enjoyed it as much as I did.

Emma is turning into a real Mommy's girl. She loves to snuggle, especially while I'm sleeping or sitting on the couch. If she wasn't so damn cute she'd be a real pain in the neck. Last night me and my girl went for a big walk around the neighbourhood. The humidity had dropped after a storm came through and it was quite pleasant for a change. It was good to leave Trusty at home and be able to walk at a decent pace - I certainly got hot and sweaty so it did me some good. I worked on my canvas work piece last night and if I'd been able to stick with it another 30 min then I would have finished. It went really fast once I started doing the larger motifs. I'm really pleased with the way it has turned out and the colours, beads and sparklies are beautiful. Now I have to decide how to finish it. Karen and I spent the day at "In Stitches" in Maryland taking a needlepoint class. The teacher was Michael Boren and we stitched his design "Scheherazade". We had already chosen our colors and mine is "Blue Lagoon" and although I don't know what the finished project will look like I know it is going to look stunning. The array of fibers we used was incredible - cottons, silks, overdyes, flair, metallics, sparkle rays, and beads. It made a nice change from cross stitch and I will definitely be doing some more canvas work in the future (once I've finished this one of course!). While I spent the day playing, Pete has been cleaning, working in the yard and doing laundry - what a guy!

Now I need to go and look at my gels to see if what I observed yesterday was real. I have a big sinking feeling in my stomach. ugh

It has been a LONG, LONG time since I did a happy dance at work. The lymphotoxin PCR worked AND it looks like I have a very interesting result in my KO mice. Woohoo!!!! I feel so relieved that I have actually achieved something. Of course it could turn out to be a fluke or something but I shouldn't think like that, and I should savour this moment. Like Joy said, this is why we keep plugging away at research and what makes it all worthwhile. She is right but I wish these moments weren't spaced at yearly intervals lol... I will never be able to repay Joy for everything she has done for me and once again she is here for me now. This was her idea, she helped me get started and already has a lot of future plans. Another minor HD today was doing the ELISAs for Al. I was pretty nervous but they worked and maybe there is something interesting. I will repeat the experiment next week with replicates and hope he is happy. It is impt that I keep the big boss happy! If I do a good job with this maybe I could ask him to be a referee for me. hmmm...is that a good idea or not??

This will be a place for me to record the daily events of my life, my thoughts and progress on my craft projects. So often I feel like my life just passes me by without thought or comment from me. Hopefully this blog will allow me to stop the train for a few seconds and take a few breaths before continuing on my way.

Work is really starting to get me down. I can't remember a time when I've been so unmotivated and its a struggle to get to work in the morning and achieve anything during the day. I am trying to work out what the problem is. 1. It's summer so I feel like being outside doing fun things. It's also only 3 weeks until I'm on vacation/get married so I have other things on my mind. 2. This is the 4th year of my post doc and it's time for me to move on (if I could find a job which is another story) 3. I have spent a year working on a very difficult project, which has involved repeating experiments done (badly) by previous lab members. I get very little satisfaction out of it and the light at the end of the tunnel is extremely dim some days. 4. My experiments have been going badly and I seem to take one step forward and then two back. 5. My creativity level is low and even if I could work on what I want to I doubt I could think of anything interesting to do. 6. My boss is away a lot and when he is here he makes me anxious so I go out of my way to hide from him. I feel guilty beause there are so many wonderful things about working here and I should be extremely grateful for the opportunities I have. I hate people who continually whine and I think I am turning into one of them. I don't know what the solution is. Some things which might help and which I have control of: 1. The stupid project-from-hell really is ALMOST THERE. Heck, we just need to make a few corrections and it looks like the journal will accept it and I will never need to work on it again. I need to get stuck in and just do it! If I tried I could get it done before the wedding and then I could start afresh when I get back. 2. The chemical I need for one of my other projects arrived this week so I have that to work on and I DID find that project interesting a few months ago. I should get that data out and start planning some experiments. 3. TRY to stop stressing about finding another job. I still have nearly 2 years on my visa. 4. Making a to-do list sometimes helps. 5. Go home, snuggle on the couch with Pete and Emma, stitch and watch the Olympics. urlLink

The paper recycling bin is full and my desk is a paradise of organization. I hope I didn't throw away anything important! I also did some online shopping yesterday and ordered the M design's "P" I need for the wedding sampler, as well as some new fabric and threads. I also ordered a secret chart for someone special, and I hope I can get it finished in time. My weather pixie has been wearing long pants the past few days which means that the weather has been beautiful.
